snippet: The New York attorney general’s office is investigating 13 large retailers over whether increasingly unpredictable and on-call work schedules violate the state’s labor laws.
abstract: New York Atty Gen Eric Schneiderman's office is investigating 13 retailers, including Gap, Abercrombie & Fitch, Target and J Crew, for possible violations of state labor laws; says it is responding to complaints about how companies schedule work shifts and whether they are paying employees appropriately for cancelled hours.
lead_paragraph: The New York attorney general’s office is investigating 13 large retailers over whether increasingly unpredictable and on-call work schedules violate the state’s labor laws.

headline.main: Retailers Scrutinized for Schedules and Staffing
